profile.name: Bill Truong
profile.title: Unity Developer & Technical Artist
profile.quote: Robust code architecture meets high-performance rendering.
profile.about: I am a Unity Engineer with a rare edge: I dominate both the Codebase and the Render Pipeline. My core expertise is Advanced C# Programming and System Architecture, but unlike typical developers, I don't rely on others to optimize the visuals. I build complex gameplay systems, write the shaders to support them, and engineer the tools to make them performant. I am the 'Full-Stack' Game Developer who ensures the game logic is solid, the tools are efficient, and the final frame renders at 90 FPS.
profile.location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam (Open to Remote/Relocation)

companies.name: GAMELOFT
companies.story: Gameloft was where I built my technical foundation. Working on Applaydu, an app with millions of users, I learned to manage technical debt and apply clean code practices under tight deadlines. My mentor pushed me hard, which helped me develop the discipline to handle large-scale projects. I included a photo of my desk because it reminds me of that focused environment.

companies.name: FPT IS (akaVerse)
companies.story: At akaVerse, I had the freedom to explore advanced ideas, from shaders to Omniverse integration. I developed an automation tool that streamlined heritage digitization, turning weeks of work into a single-click process and helping meet project deadlines. I presented to NVIDIA's CEO and collaborated on high-profile partnerships. Though I enjoyed the supportive team, I moved on when the focus shifted to industrial 3D outsourcing, as I wanted to stay in game development.

companies.name: CURLY BLUE
companies.story: Shmackle was visually flat and struggling to hold 72 FPS using basic Unlit shaders when I joined. I took ownership of the visual overhaul, writing custom HLSL shaders for Toon Shading, Outlines, and Dissolve effects. This 'Graphics Update' not only modernized the game's look but, through aggressive optimization, actually increased performance to a stable 90 FPS on Meta Quest. My ability to bridge art and engineering led to my promotion to Technical Artist.

companies.name: GOLDEN SEA STUDIO
companies.story: This was a high-velocity production environment. I handled full-cycle development for outsourced Hyper Casual titles, typically shipping a complete game every 1-2 months. This role trained me to code for speed, adapt instantly to client feedback, and deliver polished core loops under strict deadlines.

companies.name: MARATHON EDU
companies.story: In this freelance role, I taught while gaining exposure to a large EdTech company's infrastructure and operations.

productions.name: KINDLY'S PROMISE
productions.desc: Narrative Sci-Fi Adventure | Advanced URP Rendering
productions.story: This project is my technical playground a proof of concept for high-fidelity stylized rendering on Unity URP. Developing solo, I architected the entire codebase, including a modular Interaction System and non-linear Dialogue Engine. Visually, I engineered a custom render pipeline featuring a 'See-Through Dissolve' mechanic (using Stencil Buffers), dynamic Cel-Shading, and interactive foliage. It represents my ability to marry complex C# systems with artistic direction.

productions.name: SHMACKLE VR
productions.story: I handled networking for multi-user sessions and optimized for Quest standalone to maintain 72 FPS. The Shooting Range update, which I led, significantly increased player engagement.

productions.name: ANIMAL PUSH ROYALE
productions.story: As a top finalist in Vietnam GameVerse, I boosted performance by 300% through rewritten threading and custom shaders for mobile crowds.

productions.name: BILL BIOME SHADER
productions.story: This suite uses GPU instancing for dense environments, with interactive foliage and an in-editor painting tool.

productions.name: BILL SSOUTLINE
productions.story: A screen-space outline solution using Render Graph, addressing occlusion issues with Sobel algorithms.

productions.name: AKAVERSE TWIN
productions.story: My automation tools optimized rendering for large CAD models in WebGL, reducing setup time dramatically.

productions.name: APPLAYDU
productions.story: I contributed to core mechanics like Treasure Toss, adapting to enterprise workflows and high standards.

dev.desc: Responsible for the visual pipeline and performance optimization of Shmackle VR.

Promoted to Technical Artist role to focus on bridging the gap between gameplay code and visual fidelity.
Developed core networking features for the 'Shooting Range' update using Photon Fusion.
Implemented technical solutions for dynamic FOV to minimize VR motion sickness.
